page.title: 04Home Farm, Littleton
page.content: In the centre of Littleton village is Home Farm which occupies a site of about thirty acres.The farm house is two hundred years old.Some of the land is used for growing crops which include :turnips,kail,rape and grass.There are also a number of animals on the farm:100 beef cattle,65 cows and about 100 sheep and chickens and hens.Most of the cattle are slaughtered but some of the cows and sheep are sold;along with milk to a local dairy.There are 3 tractors,2 mowing machines,a hay turner and a hay bailer on the farm.The owners like living in Littleton although they said a car was essential because of the relative isolation of the village.
